Pre-Game Insights: The game is a winner-take-all bout back in Cleveland on Saturday
The starting pitchers for the game are expected to be Matthew Boyd for the Guardians and Tarik Skubal for the Tigers
The Guardians will have to be ready to go against Skubal, who has not allowed a run in either of his two outings in this postseason
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was originally scheduled for 8 p.m. ET on Saturday but was moved up to 1 p.m. ET due to the threat of inclement weather
The winner will advance to face the Yankees in the ALCS beginning Monday night in the Bronx
Others: The Guardians and Tigers split the first four games of this round at the otherâ€™s ballpark
Austin Hedges, the Guardians catcher, expressed both excitement and exhaustion after the game
The Guardians catcher, Austin Hedges, said that Cleveland will be loud for the game
The Tigers manager, A.J. Hinch, said that everything they've been playing for up to this point is now going to be on Saturday
